# accessibilitySelectedChildren()

**Instance Method**

Returns the layout area’s currently selected children.

## Declaration

```swift
func accessibilitySelectedChildren() -> [Any]?
```

## Return Value

An array containing the currently selected children. If no children are selected, this method returns an empty array.

## Discussion

This method is the getter for the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibilityProtocol] protocol’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAccessibility-c.protocol/accessibilitySelectedChildren] property.

## Supporting Accessibility

- **accessibilityChildren()**: Returns the accessibility element’s children in the accessibility hierarchy.
- **accessibilityFocusedUIElement**: The child accessibility element with the current focus.
- **accessibilityLabel()**: Returns a short description of the layout area.
